positive.review: This game is free, it is really fun to play with friends on, new updates almost every week, BUT there is a lot of ways to use real money. Nothing wrong with that, it's a free game, gotta make money somehow though. Not a lot to say obviously, but they also collaborate with real people, games, movies, heck even youtubers. But, it's free. If you don't like it, it's free. No loss.

Game is way better than fall guys. less people per match, quicker lobby times, havent had longer than 15 sec wait in unranked. Actually get to play a lot of different levels unlike fall guys where you may play the same level like 5 out of 7 times. A lot of skins to choose from obviosuly you may have to pay but there is so many different skins. They still do events and seasons and for me personally i think this is better than fall guys.I play fall guys on ps5 and stumble guys on pc and this is way better, even with playing the game with a mouse and keyboard.

Rating: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ (3/5)

I‚Äôve played Stumble Guys a lot on mobile, and honestly, I still prefer the mobile version. Even though the PC version is basically the same and just as good, something about playing it on mobile hits differently for me personally.

But there‚Äôs one big W for the PC version:
üëâ No ads!
That alone makes the experience much smoother and way less annoying compared to mobile.

I‚Äôm really happy to see a mobile game come to Steam, and to be honest‚Ä¶
I think it‚Äôs better than Fall Guys, lmao ;)

If you enjoy light-hearted chaos and quick matches, this version is definitely worth trying.

This game is pure, chaotic fun‚Äîperfect for a quick session with friends. It's totally easy to jump into, and watching everyone wipe out on those crazy obstacle courses never gets old. Yeah, sometimes the physics are kinda janky, but that's part of the charm! It‚Äôs genuinely chevous to snag a victory royale after failing 50 times. Highly recommended if you just want to laugh. Best free-to-play party game out there!

this game is very fun you can compete in all different kinds of races and you can also use abilitys to hit opponents  to make them fall. You can unlock many avatars, footsteps have fun playing! thank you for your time

Stumble Guys √© o jogo que responde √† pergunta: "O que acontece se voc√™ colocar 32 pessoas desastradas em uma pista de obst√°culos desenhada por algu√©m que odeia a humanidade?". O resultado √© um caos glorioso, onde a vit√≥ria √© menos sobre habilidade e mais sobre quem cai de cara no ch√£o por √∫ltimo.
A Realidade Nua e Crua
O jogo √© um banquete de cores neon e f√≠sica de gelatina. √â o Fall Guys com um tempero extra de frustra√ß√£o m√≥vel, mas na Steam ele brilha com a sua simplicidade viciante.
A "Habilidade": Voc√™ acha que √© bom em jogos de plataforma? Stumble Guys est√° aqui para te provar que voc√™ n√£o √©. Voc√™ vai escorregar no gelo, ser empurrado por um taco de beisebol gigante, e cair no limbo porque um pinguim te deu um encontr√£o. A habilidade real √© a sua capacidade de rir do seu pr√≥prio fracasso.
Os Mapas (e o √ìdio por Eles): Todos temos aquele mapa que odiamos com todas as for√ßas (sim, estou falando de voc√™, Tundra Run e seus blocos de gelo trai√ßoeiros). A cada nova rodada, a emo√ß√£o de se classificar √© seguida imediatamente pelo p√¢nico de qual ser√° o pr√≥ximo inferno de obst√°culos.
A Comunidade Competitiva: N√£o se engane com os avatares fofinhos. As pessoas neste jogo fariam qualquer coisa para te empurrar para fora da plataforma final. √â uma guerra psicol√≥gica disfar√ßada de festa infantil.
As Skins (O Verdadeiro Jogo Final): O objetivo principal n√£o √© vencer a coroa. √â ter a skin mais rara e rid√≠cula poss√≠vel. Um gorila com chap√©u de festa? Sim, por favor. Um MrBeast gigante? Claro. A ostenta√ß√£o das skins √© metade da divers√£o.
Veredito
Positivo. √â o jogo perfeito para jogar 15 minutos e acabar jogando 2 horas. Gr√°tis para jogar, viciante e excelente para liberar a raiva (ou criar mais) com amigos. Instale, caia, levante e tente de novo. A coroa te espera!

I‚Äôve spent some time with this game and honestly, it surprised me in a way I didn‚Äôt fully expect. I don‚Äôt want to sound dramatic, but there‚Äôs something oddly satisfying about how everything fits together ‚Äî not in some perfect, polished ‚Äúadvertisement‚Äù way, but more like a game that knows exactly what it wants to be and just‚Ä¶ goes for it.

The first thing I noticed is the atmosphere. Every part of the game ‚Äî the visuals, the sound, the pacing ‚Äî kind of blends into this feeling that you‚Äôre actually inside its world, even if you‚Äôre just casually playing. I know that sounds a bit clich√©, but it‚Äôs true. Sometimes it‚Äôs chaotic, sometimes slow, sometimes you‚Äôre just wandering around thinking ‚Äúok, what now?‚Äù but that‚Äôs honestly part of the charm. The game doesn‚Äôt try to rush you unless it actually needs to.

Gameplay-wise, it has this mix of familiar elements and small twists that keep things from feeling stale. Nothing groundbreaking, maybe, but it all works together in a way that feels natural. There were moments when I thought ‚Äúyeah, I‚Äôve seen this in other games,‚Äù but then the game throws in tiny details or unexpected interactions that make it stand out just enough. It‚Äôs the kind of thing you only notice after a few hours, when you start connecting the dots.

Performance has been mostly fine. A little rough spot here and there, but honestly, show me a game these days that doesn‚Äôt have something weird happening once in a while. Nothing game-breaking on my end, at least. You can clearly tell the developers put effort into this, even if a few edges are still a bit sharp. Again ‚Äî part of the charm.

What I really appreciate is that the game gives you space to play the way you want. Some people will rush through every objective, others will take their time exploring or messing around, and both approaches actually feel valid. I like games that don‚Äôt punish you for not following some ‚Äúcorrect‚Äù path.

Overall, I‚Äôd say this is one of those titles that grows on you the longer you play. It doesn‚Äôt try too hard to impress in the first five minutes ‚Äî instead it slowly builds its identity, layer by layer, until you suddenly realize you‚Äôve been playing way longer than you planned. If you‚Äôre looking for something that balances comfort with challenge, familiar mechanics with fresh touches, and a world that‚Äôs just fun to be in, then I genuinely think this one is worth giving a shot.

Would I recommend it?
Yeah, I would ‚Äî maybe not to everyone, because no game is for everyone, but definitely to anyone who likes getting lost in a game for a bit and discovering things at their own pace.

Stumble Guys is an amazing game because it combines fast-paced, chaotic fun with lighthearted competition that appeals to players of all ages. Developed by Kitka Games, it offers a perfect mix of humor, challenge, and excitement in every round. The gameplay is simple yet addictive‚Äîyou race against dozens of players through colorful obstacle courses filled with slippery surfaces, swinging hammers, and moving platforms. The unpredictable physics and cartoonish visuals make every stumble hilarious, turning even failures into moments of laughter. One of the best parts of Stumble Guys is its accessibility; anyone can jump in and play within seconds, whether on mobile or PC, without needing a complex tutorial. Its multiplayer mode encourages friendly rivalry among friends, creating endless opportunities for funny moments and shared victories. The game‚Äôs regular updates, themed events, and customizable skins keep it fresh and engaging, allowing players to express their personality through quirky outfits and emotes. The bright graphics, cheerful music, and quick matches make it easy to enjoy anytime, whether you‚Äôre playing for five minutes or an hour. Moreover, the community around Stumble Guys is lively and welcoming, constantly sharing tips, memes, and creative plays. Ultimately, Stumble Guys stands out because it doesn‚Äôt take itself too seriously‚Äîit‚Äôs about pure, joyful chaos where anyone can win (or fall) spectacularly. Its blend of simplicity, humor, and fun competition makes it one of the most entertaining and replayable party games available today.

I'm trying to 100% every game in my steam library, and looking at these achievements for stumble guys, their really easy, the only problem is, the achievements have been broken for over a year. The dev's don't care enough to fix it and it's almost impossible to 100% this game without having to re-do everything and hoping and praying you get the achievements. Now for the game itself, its pretty fun I guess, it's a game you and your friends would play for like 20-30 minutes and get off cause it gets repetitive and boring.

The characters are way overpriced and even get up to $30! Some of the wheels you have to pay to spin give you items you could get for free and if you pay for the battle pass, you can just steamroll your way through the crowds by hitting them off. Never recommend, even if the game is free.
(Edit:) The game is also full of bots that makes the game feel more empty than it already was.

Ich hab ja gedacht, Stumble Guys w√§r so ein nettes, kleines Partyspiel f√ºr zwischendurch. So was, was man mit Freunden lacht, ‚Äône Runde dreht, bisschen Spa√ü hat.

Spoiler: Der Spa√ü bleibt meistens auf der Strecke ‚Äî zusammen mit meinem Charakter, der mal wieder von der Map geflogen ist, weil die Physik sich gedacht hat: ‚ÄûHeute nicht, Bruder.‚Äú

Erstmal das Offensichtliche: Das Spiel f√ºhlt sich an, als w√§r‚Äôs auf Speed gebaut und dann dreimal zur√ºckportiert worden. Alles wackelt, rutscht, buggt, und du hast permanent das Gef√ºhl, die Steuerung ist aus Gummi. Pr√§zision? Fehlanzeige. Dein Charakter l√§uft, als w√ºrde er auf Butter gleiten.

Dann der Ping ‚Äì der eigentliche Endgegner in Stumble Guys. Egal wie gut du spielst, am Ende gewinnst du nicht, weil du skill hast, sondern weil der Server Gnade zeigt. Du springst perfekt ‚Äì und wirst trotzdem nach hinten teleportiert. Du rutschst auf einer glatten Fl√§che aus, auf der eigentlich nichts ist. Und manchmal wirst du einfach so eliminiert, ohne dass du wei√üt, was du falsch gemacht hast.

Der Content? Wenn du drei Runden gespielt hast, hast du 90 % des Spiels gesehen. Immer dieselben Maps, dieselben Fallen, dieselben Zufallsmechaniken. Es ist nicht mal mehr frustrierend ‚Äì nur noch erm√ºdend.

Klar, es gibt neue Skins. Jede Woche. Jede verdammte Woche. Und nat√ºrlich stecken sie hinter Paywalls, Season P√§ssen oder irgendwelchen Gl√ºcksspiel-Kisten.

Stumble Guys ist im Prinzip:

10 % Spa√ü

20 % Frust

70 % Werbung, Pop-ups und ‚ÄûKauf jetzt dieses Ultra-Legendary-Rainbow-Kitty-Paket f√ºr nur 19,99 ‚Ç¨‚Äú


Ich will gar nicht wissen, wie viele Stunden meines Lebens ich damit verbracht habe, in der Lobby auf ‚ÄûStart‚Äú zu dr√ºcken, w√§hrend das Spiel mir f√ºnf Mal sagt, ich soll mir ein ‚Äûbesonderes Angebot‚Äú anschauen.

Ach ja, und dann kommt noch das absolute Highlight: Mobile Port auf PC.
Alles f√ºhlt sich an, als w√§re es nie f√ºr Maus und Tastatur gedacht gewesen. Die Men√ºs sind ein Desaster, das UI schreit Handyspiel, und manchmal erkennt das Spiel deine Eingaben einfach gar nicht.

Ich hab‚Äôs ehrlich versucht. Ich hab‚Äôs mit Freunden gespielt, ich hab‚Äôs solo gespielt, ich hab mir eingeredet, dass es ja ‚Äûf√ºr zwischendurch‚Äú ist. Aber irgendwann merkst du: Es gibt kein ‚Äûzwischendurch‚Äú ‚Äì es gibt nur ‚Äûwieder rausfliegen, wieder genervt Alt + F4‚Äú.

Und das Matchmaking? Pure Magie. Du triffst auf Leute mit Skins, die aussehen, als h√§tten sie das Spiel studiert ‚Äì und auf Bots, die gerade versuchen, √ºberhaupt zu verstehen, was Schwerkraft ist.

Das Schlimmste ist aber, dass es trotzdem irgendwie s√ºchtig macht. Du klickst auf ‚Äûnoch eine Runde‚Äú, weil du denkst, ‚Äûdiesmal gewinn ich‚Äôs‚Äú. Und dann stolperst du ‚Äì wieder.

I'll start this by saying that I'm a completionist. I don't like being left out on unique unlocks and exclusive things. Anyway, me and my fiance both started playing this game at the same time. They have some trophy meter on the right to get special unlocks from a pinata. I don't have that option on my game. I also don't have a market section in my shop like they do. My friend joined yesterday and they too have these features that I don't have. I contacted support and said that it's part of a testing group before they release new features. I asked how I can join that because I'm the only one in my group who isn't a part of that, and they told me they can't. So I'm left behind while my friends and fiance get cool rewards and I'm the one actually winning the games.

Kind of a stretch to call it "multiplayer" if the invite feature never works & there are always server errors that randomly kick you from the game. Also selects the same 5 maps every time you play instead of new ones. Maps are pretty boring, get really repetitive, and the controls for jumping & diving suck. If you accidentally jump twice, you're basically dead, as it takes an entire second to get back up. Just a cheap knockoff of an already free game that has no purpose to be made.

Stumble guys, is a game not dissimilar to another game fall guys, while it is wrong to critique the game on taking inspiration, this game has certain cons that, as a player, i feel are worth addressing. While the game has issues, it isn't without its own merit, the games visuals are good, the colours pop and the art style of the game is overall nice, the environments are interesting and the levels contained within, are fun and action packed. the game however has many flaws, the matches seemed to be filled with mostly bots, very little human players, while the use of micro transactions is understandable for a free game, i feel they're a bit overbearing, there's very little that can be done without partaking, the frame rate is. in conclusion, the game is a suitable replacement for fall guys, however isn't much more than that, the micro transactions are overbearing, and the gameplay can be sloppy at times. overall i would rate this game 4.5/10, which in a word would be "alright"
Although its free, I would rather have an Indian scammer fraud my credit and debit cards than to pay a single unit of the cheapest currency that exists.

[b]# --- MY THOUGHTS:[/b]

I'd like to mention the fact that I have no issues with the core gameplay of this Fall Guys clone. It plays smoothly and its everything you expect it to be. No, my issues are of a different kind.

First of all, I hate the fact that [i]Stumble Guys[/i] is [i]all[/i] about micro-transactions. You could make the argument that many other games have micro-transactions, sure, but what really bothers me is that you are [i]required[/i] to spend money on these stupid micro-transactions in order to get some of the achievements this game has.

Second of all, there are many achievements related to maps that no longer show up [i]at all[/i], or have an astronomically low chance of ever showing up. This locks anyone who wishes to fully complete the game (achievement wise) out.

Lastly, the currency you would get in this game by taking part in the mentioned micro-transactions is [i]way[/i] too overpriced.

Due to the fact that 1. I am not made of money and 2. the game isn't [i]THAT[/i] fun to excuse the micro-transactions, I am abandoning my achievement hunting for [i]Stumble Guys[/i]. Too bad. I would have really liked to put in the hours to complete it.

[b]# --- RATING: 4.5/10[/b]

It is completely unacceptable that this has Very Positive reviews, this game is genuinely SO horrible!!??
